definition: Michiko, Japanese female given name/Empress Michiko of Japan (1934-)
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: That I will never meet Michiko Kakutani and so not be able to tell her what I think of her.
sentences.chinese: 再也見不到角谷美智子，沒法告訴她我對她的想法。

sentences.english: But Michiko said Monday she was fine.
sentences.chinese: 但美智子皇后於週一表示自己的身體狀況已好轉。

sentences.english: Michiko jousting with any reporter, both die.
sentences.chinese: 美智子與何記者比武，雙雙死去。

sentences.english: Concerns had been raised that the 72-year-old empress might not be up to the trip.
sentences.chinese: 72歲的美智子皇后能否出訪一直令人擔憂。

sentences.english: Michiko, Japan I am a 12 year-old girl.
sentences.chinese: 美智子，日本，我是一個12歲的小女孩。

definition: Akihito, personal name of the Heisei 平成[Ping2 cheng2] emperor of Japan (1933-), reigned 1989-2019
Hirohito, personal name of the Shōwa 昭和[Zhao1 he2] emperor of Japan (1901-1989), reigned 1925-1989
